section.name: Navigating the CMS
section.p: Hippo CMS7 has a tabbed user interface. These tabs allow the user to switch between different perspectives that all have their own state. Some actions, like for example clicking on a document link in the dashboard perspective, will automatically open up the browse perspective and highlight the corresponding document in its current location.
section.subsection: Some perspectives are static, like the dashboard (listing 1) or the browse (listing 2) perspective, which means they will always be visible (assuming the user has the appropiate rights) and cannot be closed.

Other perspectives, like the document editor, are dynamic which means they are created on-the-fly and can be closed again. This gives users the freedom to have multiple documents open simultaneously (listing 3).

section.name: Navigating the repository
section.p:
By selectting the Browse tab, the user is presented with a basic file browser interface consisting of three panes.
The left pane displays a tree-view on the repository, showing the folders the user is allowed to see. Upon clicking a folder in the tree-view, all folders and documents that belong to the selected folder will be displayed as a sortable/pageable list in the middle pane.
section.subsection: Documents and folders all have a list of (workflow)actions that can be executed upon them. These actions are displayed in the right pane and will be (re)loaded every time a user clicks on a document or folder in either the left or middle pane.
